item.title: The math behind symmetric keys generation in SSL handshake
item.description: Background The high level idea of SSL (the technology to keep your internet connection secure) is to encrypt the data that is exchanged between the server and the client. Naturally the next question is: what would be used to encrypt the data? There are two possibilities: Use assymetric key encryption Use a symmetric key Assymetric key encryption has the advantage of using public (which is of course public) key of your recipient to encrypt the data.

item.title: How was your login today?
item.description: How was your login today? “Software is eating the world”. That’s really true these days. Can you imagine not having your phone for a day? Also true: You need to login to do any meaningful work. Also true: Your data is very valuable than ever. Also true: Most of the websites, apps provide poor login/authentication experience. Why is it so? It is for a variety of reasons: Authentication is not the core experience of most businesses, but every app needs to authenticate the users.
